br.uff.midiacom.ana.transition
Class NCLTransition<T extends NCLElement,Ed extends NCLDescriptor>

java.lang.Object
  br.uff.midiacom.ana.util.xml.XMLElementPrototype<T>
      br.uff.midiacom.ana.util.ncl.NCLElementPrototype<T>
          br.uff.midiacom.ana.util.ncl.NCLIdentifiableElementPrototype<T>
              br.uff.midiacom.ana.transition.NCLTransition<T,Ed>
Type Parameters:
T -
P -
I -
All Implemented Interfaces:
NCLElement<T>, ReferredElement<Ed>, XMLElement<T>
public class NCLTransition<T extends NCLElement,Ed extends NCLDescriptor>
extends NCLIdentifiableElementPrototype<T>
implements NCLElement<T>, ReferredElement<Ed>

Class that represents a transition. A transition defines a transition effect used when presenting (begin or end) an media object.
This element defines the attributes:

  • id - id of the transition. This attribute is required.
  • type - type of the transition. This attribute is required.
  • subtype - subtype of the transition. This attribute is optional.
  • dur - transition duration. This attribute is optional.
  • startProgress - transition begin progress. This attribute is optional.
  • endProgress - transition end progress. This attribute is optional.
  • direction - transition direction. This attribute is optional.
  • fadeColor - color to fade when the type is fade. This attribute is optional.
  • horRepeat - repetitions of the transition in the horizontal axis. This attribute is optional.
  • vertRepeat - repetitions of the transition in the vertical axis. This attribute is optional.
  • borderWidth - width of the border. This attribute is optional.
  • borderColor - color of the border. This attribute is optional.

Sets the transition type. The type is required and can not be set to null. The possible transition type values are defined in the enumeration NCLTransitionType.

public void setSubtype(NCLTransitionSubtype subtype)

The subtype value must be related to the type attribute value. The possible transition subtype values are defined in the enumeration NCLTransitionSubtype.

setDur

public void setDur(TimeType dur)
            throws XMLException
Sets the transition duration. This attribute is optional. Set the duration to null to erase a duration already defined.
The default transition duration is 1 second.

Parameters:
dur - element representing the transition duration or null to erase a duration already defined.
Throws:
XMLException

getDur

public TimeType getDur()
Returns the transition duration or null if the attribute is not defined.
The default transition duration is 1 second.

Returns:
element representing the transition duration or null if the attribute is not defined.

setStartProgress

public void setStartProgress(java.lang.Double startProgress)
                      throws XMLException
Sets the transition progress in the beginning of the transition. This attribute is optional. Set the progress to null to erase an progress already defined.
This progress means that the transition will begin already with a certain amount of it done. For example, in a transition that presents the media object increasing its transparency, the start progress indicates the initial transparency value.
The default start progress value is 0.

Parameters:
startProgress - number between 0 and 1, or null to erase a progress already defined.
Throws:
XMLException - if the number is not between 0 and 1.

getStartProgress

public java.lang.Double getStartProgress()
Returns the transition progress in the beginning of the transition or null if the attribute is not defined.
This progress means that the transition will begin already with a certain amount of it done. For example, in a transition that presents the media object increasing its transparency, the start progress indicates the initial transparency value.
The default start progress value is 0.

Returns:
number between 0 and 1, or null if the attribute is not defined.

setEndProgress

public void setEndProgress(java.lang.Double endProgress)
                    throws XMLException
Sets the transition progress in the end of the transition. This attribute is optional. Set the progress to null to erase an progress already defined.
This progress means that the transition will end with a certain amount of it not done. For example, in a transition that presents the media object increasing its transparency, the end progress indicates the final transparency value.
The default end progress value is 1.

Parameters:
endProgress - number between 0 and 1, or null to erase a progress already defined.
Throws:
XMLException - if the number is not between 0 and 1.

getEndProgress

public java.lang.Double getEndProgress()
Returns the transition progress in the end of the transition or null if the attribute is not defined.
This progress means that the transition will end with a certain amount of it not done. For example, in a transition that presents the media object increasing its transparency, the end progress indicates the final transparency value.
The default end progress value is 1.

Returns:
number between 0 and 1, or null if the attribute is not defined.

setDirection

public void setDirection(NCLTransitionDirection direction)
                  throws XMLException
Sets the transition direction, that is, forward or reverse. This attribute is optional. Set direction to null to erase a direction already defined.
Not all transition types will have an reverse interpretation. In general this attribute is used with geometric transitions. The possible direction values are defined in the enumeration NCLTransitionDirection.
The default direction value is forward.

Parameters:
direction - element representing the transition direction from the enumeration NCLTransitionDirection.
Throws:
XMLException

getDirection

public NCLTransitionDirection getDirection()
Returns the transition direction, that is, forward or reverse or null if the attribute is not defined.
Not all transition types will have an reverse interpretation. In general this attribute is used with geometric transitions. The possible direction values are defined in the enumeration NCLTransitionDirection.
The default direction value is forward

Returns:
element representing the transition direction from the enumeration NCLTransitionDirection or null if the attribute is not defined.

setFadeColor

public void setFadeColor(NCLColor fadeColor)
                  throws XMLException
Sets the fade color when the transition type is either fade to color or fade from color. This attribute is optional. Set the fade color to null to erase a fade color already defined.
In both cases the fade color attribute defines the final and initial colors, respectively. The possible color values are defined in the enumeration NCLColor.
The default fade color is black.

Parameters:
fadeColor - element representing the fade color from the enumeration NCLColor or null to erase a color already defined.
Throws:
XMLException

getFadeColor

public NCLColor getFadeColor()
Returns the fade color when the transition type is either fade to color or fade from color or null if the attribute is not defined.
In both cases the fade color attribute defines the final and initial colors, respectively. The possible color values are defined in the enumeration NCLColor.
The default fade color is black.

Returns:
element representing the fade color from the enumeration NCLColor or null if the attribute is not defined.

The default repetition value is 1.

setBorderWidth

public void setBorderWidth(java.lang.Integer borderWidth)
                    throws XMLException
Sets the width of the border generated in the area where the transition is applied. This attribute is optional. Set the width to null to erase a width already defined.
The border width must be a positive integer. If the width is 0, that means that no border will be generated.
The default border width is 0.

Parameters:
borderWidth - positive integer representing the border width or null to erase a width already defined.
Throws:
XMLException - if the width is negative.

getBorderWidth

public java.lang.Integer getBorderWidth()
Returns the width of the border generated in the area where the transition is applied or null if the attribute is not defined.
The border width must be a positive integer. If the width is 0, that means that no border will be generated.
The default border width is 0.

Returns:
positive integer representing the border width or null if the attribute is not defined.

setBorderColor

public void setBorderColor(java.lang.Object borderColor)
                    throws XMLException
Sets the color of the border generated in the area where the transition is applied. This attribute is optional. Set the width to null to erase a width already defined.
If the transition type is fade, that the border color defines the content of the generated border. If the attribute value is a color, than the border will be filled with the color. If the attribute is the value blend then the border will be filled with the an additive mixture of the media object colors.
The default border color is black.

Parameters:
borderColor - element representing the border color or null to erase a color already defined.
Throws:
XMLException

getBorderColor

public java.lang.Object getBorderColor()
Returns the color of the border generated in the area where the transition is applied or null if the attribute is not defined.
If the transition type is fade, that the border color defines the content of the generated border. If the attribute value is a color, than the border will be filled with the color. If the attribute is the value blend then the border will be filled with the an additive mixture of the media object colors.
The default border color is black.

Returns:
element representing the border color or null if the attribute is not defined.
